# Council of Ministers / Majlis Al-Wuzara' <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree No. 63 of 2025
### Repealing the Third Paragraph of Article 41
### of the Decree Issued on April 4, 1979
### Regarding the Civil Service System

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to May 10, 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding the Civil Service, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on April 4, 1979 regarding the Civil Service System, and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Succession and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the presentation of the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of State for Cabinet Affairs,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
The third paragraph of Article 41 of the aforementioned Decree regarding the Civil Service System shall be repealed.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the issuance of the First Instance Court's judgment – dated 25/3/2025 in Case No. (16/2024) Bankruptcy/3.
Filed by: 1- Tha'er Abdullah Rashid Al-Saif <orig>تائر عبدالله راشد السيف</orig>.
Against: 1- Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>.
2- Fatima Abdulwahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبدالواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>.

Head of the Bankruptcy Department

In the Name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The First Instance Court
Bankruptcy Circuit / 3

At the session held publicly at the Court on Tuesday, 25/3/2025 AD.
Presided over by Professor: Abdullah Ali Al-Harbi <orig>عبدالله علي الحربي</orig>
With the membership of Professor: Mohammed Abdulrahman Al-Nuwaif <orig>محمد عبدالرحمن النويف</orig>, Court Agent
And the membership of Professor: Waleed Khalid Al-Rabie <orig>وليد خالد الربيع</orig>, Court Agent
And in the presence of Mr.: Yusuf Ahmed Al-Bakr <orig>يوسف أحمد البكر</orig>, Session Secretary

(The following judgment was issued)

In Case No.: (16/2024) Bankruptcy Circuit / 3
Automated Number: 242070020
Filed by: 1- Tha'er Abdullah Rashid Al-Saif <orig>تائر عبدالله راشد السيف</orig>.
Against: 1- Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>.
2- Fatima Abdulwahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبدالواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>.

(Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
The facts of the case, the parties' documents, and their defense were previously summarized in the referral decision issued by the Bankruptcy Judge on 30/5/2024, to which the Court refers to avoid repetition. However, the Court briefly summarizes them to the necessary extent, stating that the plaintiff submitted a request to the Bankruptcy Department to initiate bankruptcy declaration proceedings against the defendants, Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, and Ms. Fatima Abdulwahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبد الواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>, along with the resulting implications.
Based on the premise that he obtained judgment No. 2021/10086 (Rentals, around 28), issued on 17/5/2022, filed by him against the first defendant company, which ordered the eviction of the property specified in the lease agreement dated 17/6/2018, its delivery free of occupants, and that it pay the plaintiff an amount of 58,800 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> for the period from 1/5/2021 to 30/11/2022, and any new rent at a rate of 8,400 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> monthly starting from 1/12/2021 until complete eviction, and obligated it to pay the expenses.

<header>
3A
Sunday, 15 Shawwal 1446 AH - 13/4/2025 AD
Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue No. 1734, Seventy-First Year
</header>
KD in exchange for actual legal fees. The judgment became final as it was not appealed. When the plaintiff commenced enforcement of this judgment, he enforced the part related to eviction, but the company did not pay the amount of KD 178,480 recorded as due from it under the judgment. The plaintiff requested to issue a notice of payment and debt settlement to the defendant company with a request dated 2023/9/5, and to the director and partner against whom the request was submitted, Abdul Wahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>عبد الواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>, on 2023/7/16. However, they did not make the payment, which led him to submit his stated request.

Whereas the request was heard before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and the plaintiff appeared through his representative and submitted a portfolio of documents including the following: photocopies of the articles of association of Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, a copy of the commercial register extract for Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig> showing partner and director data, a photocopy of a statement issued by the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> showing the recorded amounts and a list of cases filed against the first defendant company, a photocopy of judgment No. 2019/5826, Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> Total Rents 7, and a photocopy of the bank accounts of the first defendant company. The defendant appeared through their legal representative, who stated that settlement was not possible and requested to proceed with the procedures. On 2024/2/19, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> was contacted to provide an opinion on the submitted request. The committee's opinion, dated 2024/3/19, concluded that the committee was unable to study and prepare a report on the debtor due to the absence of the debtor's financial position, with a proposal to appoint a trustee from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and prepare an updated financial position, with the trustee's fees estimated based on 40 working hours, totaling KD 2,000. Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 2024/4/28 to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures for Nasrallah General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله للتجارة العامة</orig>. The date 2022/5/17 was set as a provisional date for cessation of payments, and the decision was published and announced in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and stakeholders were notified, and Ms. Rabia Al-Maha <orig>رابعه المها</orig> was appointed as trustee for the bankruptcy. Her fees were estimated at a total of two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> from the date of this decision until the closure of the bankruptcy, and accordingly, she was to inventory the debtor company's assets and properties, take all necessary precautionary measures, and prepare a list of debts and a liquidation and distribution plan. On 2024/5/30, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision (Firstly): to refer the documents to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> according to the report, in preparation for a judgment regarding the declaration of bankruptcy of the first defendant, Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>.

In implementation of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision, the documents were referred to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> and registered under the number stated at the beginning of the judgment. The plaintiff appeared through his legal representative, insisting on the requests, and the bankruptcy trustee also appeared in person. She submitted unsegregated documents, which the court reviewed, consisting of a report on the bankruptcy of the first defendant company. Upon reviewing it, the court found that the aforementioned company had no assets other than an account at Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig> containing KD 52.267 (fifty-two dinars and 267 fils). The court decided to reserve the case for judgment at today's session.

Regarding the subject of the request submitted by the plaintiff, it is stipulated in Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 2020/71</orig> that "For the purpose of applying this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings assigned to each of them ...... Financial Imbalance: The debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts."

It is stipulated in Article 2 of the same Law that "The provisions of this Law shall apply to:
1- Every natural person proven to have the status of a merchant.
2- Kuwaiti companies and branches of foreign companies, with the exception of joint ventures.
3- It is stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 13 of the same Law that "The debtor may submit a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to commence preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures within a maximum period of two months from the date of cessation of payments or from the date on which he had information indicating that he would be unable to pay his debts when due, unless any of the creditors or supervisory authorities have submitted a request to commence procedures within the aforementioned period. Failure to submit the request within the deadlines specified in this paragraph shall not result in the inadmissibility of the request."

It is stipulated in Article 131 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that "Subject to the provisions stipulated in this Law regarding the request to commence procedures, as well as the cases specified in the chapter on preventive settlement and the chapter on restructuring, in which the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may issue a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met:
1- The debtor has ceased payments.
2- There is a financial imbalance in the debtor's financial position.
3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."

It is stipulated in Article 132 of the same Law that "In all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the request to commence procedures to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues the decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report on the procedures taken regarding the request from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence procedures shall be deposited in the file, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
<page_end>3</page_end>

previously, the plaintiff's request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the defendant company is based on a sound foundation, necessitating a judgment in his favor, as will be stated in the operative part of the judgment.
And whereas, regarding the request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the second defendant / Fatima Abdul Wahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبد الواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>, it was established to the court that the first defendant company is a limited liability company and the second defendant was a partner in it, and the provisions of the law have stipulated that a partner in a limited liability company is not liable for the company's obligations except to the extent of their share in the capital. Furthermore, the company's manager is not liable for the company's obligations except in cases of violating the provisions of the law, the company's articles of association, or errors in management, none of which were found in the documents. Since the plaintiff submitted a request for her bankruptcy in her capacity as the owner of the aforementioned first defendant company, his request is based on an incorrect foundation, as the company has a legal personality and a financial liability independent of that of the second defendant. Therefore, it is necessary to rule to reject his request based on these reasons, without explicitly stating it in the operative part of the judgment.
And whereas, regarding the expenses, including legal fees, the court obliges the defendant to pay them in accordance with the provisions of Article 1/119 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(For these reasons)

### The Court Ruled:
To declare the bankruptcy of the first defendant / Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig> and to set May 17, 2022, as the provisional date for the cessation of payments. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and publish its summary in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and to add expenses and an amount of ten dinars for legal fees to be borne by the bankruptcy estate.

It is established that Article 172 of the same law states that "the state of bankruptcy shall not arise except by a judgment declaring bankruptcy. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy declaration judgment, announce its operative part, publish it, disclose it on the Kuwait Stock Exchange <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> if the debtor is listed therein, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on their website and register it as specified in Article 33 of this law. It shall also, within ten days from the date of that judgment, publish and announce its summary."
It is established that "a limited liability company has its financial liability independent of the liability of its partners, and therefore, the manager representing this company has their personal financial liability independent of it. Their liability for damage caused to third parties is a tortious liability that is established by proving the manager's fault and the existence of a causal link between this fault and the damage incurred."
(Appeal 1022/2003 Commercial, Session 30/6/2024)
It is established that "companies acquire a legal personality independent of the persons of their partners, and consequently, they shall have a financial liability independent and separate from the liability of their partners."
(Appeal 1053/2004 Commercial, Session 11/6/2005)
It is established that "the trial court has full authority to ascertain the facts of the case from its documents, papers, and the evidence and presumptions presented. It may deduce from the facts of the case and the conduct of the litigants the presumptions upon which it relies in forming its conviction, provided that its deduction is reasonable and supported by evidence and grounds firmly established in the documents, leading to the conclusion it reached. The court distinguishes itself by intervening if the conclusion it drew from those facts does not comply with its legal requirements."
(Appeal 704/2000 Commercial, Session 11/2/2002)
And whereas, regarding the request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the first defendant, Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, it was established to the court that it ceased to pay the outstanding debt, and no balance sheets or assets were found to indicate its financial position. The debt was proven against it by a final judicial judgment which obligated the first defendant to pay the claimed amount. Furthermore, the bankruptcy judge issued a decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings and considered May 17, 2022, as the date of cessation of payments, which is the date of the final judgment issued against it. Consequently, the court concludes that there was a deficit in the financial position of the first defendant company, which resulted in the cessation of payments and the inability of the company's operations to continue. ## (Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
Whereas the facts of the lawsuit and the documents of the two plaintiffs previously obtained the referral decision issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> on 30/5/2024 in Application No. (11/2022 Declaration of Bankruptcy <orig>شهر إفلاس</orig>), to which the Court refers to avoid repetition, but summarizes it to the necessary extent that the two plaintiffs submitted an application to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings, based on the fact that they are debtors to the defendants by virtue of several judgments and bank checks on different dates, and that they ceased payment of debt in their financial position, and therefore the two plaintiffs had the right to submit an application to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings against them, hence the lawsuit.
And whereas the application was considered before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and on 19/12/2022, he issued his decision to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> for examination regarding the request and the period of availability of its substantive conditions as stated in the decision, to which the Court refers to avoid repetition.
And in implementation of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> submitted its report No. 13 dated 26/3/2023, in which it concluded that "the continuation of the company's activity is futile due to negative financial results, therefore it is in the interest of the creditors to declare their bankruptcy and appoint a trustee <orig>أمين</orig> to sell the company's assets and stop the waste of company assets, with a proposal to take the following precautionary measures: - promptly appoint an inventory trustee <orig>أمين حصر</orig> and seize the company's assets. - promptly stop administrative and general expenses. - impose restrictions on the two debtors in disposing of their funds and assets. The trustee's fees were estimated at KWD 4000 <orig>4000 د.ك</orig>."
And after the submission of the Bankruptcy Committee's <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> report, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision on 27/5/2024 to: 1- Commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings for both: 1- Wansi General Trading and Contracting Company (LLC) <orig>شركة ونسي للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>. 2- Mohammed Younis Razam <orig>محمد يونس رظام</orig>, and to set the date of this decision as a temporary date for the cessation of payments, and to publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and notify the concerned parties. 2- Appoint Professor/ Ali Owaid Rakhees Awad <orig>علي عويد رخيص عوض</orig> as trustee <orig>أميناً على التفليسة</orig> for the bankruptcy estate, and his fees were estimated at KWD 4000 <orig>4000 د.ك</orig> from the date of this decision until the closure of the bankruptcy estate, and he is required to prepare a list of debts and a liquidation and distribution plan.
And on 30/5/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> also issued his decision to refer the bankruptcy declaration application documents, as they are, to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> along with the report.

And regarding the subject matter, as stipulated in Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 71/2020</orig>, that "In the application of this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings indicated opposite each of them ...... Financial Imbalance: The debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts."
And as stipulated in Article 2 of the same Law, that "The provisions of this Law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person proven to have the status of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies and branches of foreign companies, with the exception of joint ventures. 3- (...)"
And as stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 13 of the same Law, that "The debtor may submit a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to commence preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures within a maximum period of two months from the date of cessation of payment or from the date on which he had information suggesting that he would be unable to pay his debts when due, unless any of the creditors or regulatory bodies have submitted a request to commence procedures within the aforementioned period, and the failure to submit the request within the deadlines specified in this paragraph shall not result in the inadmissibility of the request."
And as stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 3 of Ministerial Resolution No. 31 of 2022 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 31 لسنة 2022</orig> regarding the amendment of some provisions of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 71/2020 <orig>القانون رقم 71/2020</orig> issuing the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, that "The debtor may submit a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to commence preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures within a maximum period of two months from the date of cessation of payment or from the date on which a financial imbalance occurred in his financial position or from the date on which he had information suggesting that he would be unable to pay his debts when due, or that a financial imbalance would occur in his financial position, provided that the indebtedness that the debtor ceased or expects to cease paying is not less than KWD 10,000 (ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and also provided that the amount of the actual or expected financial imbalance is not less than the aforementioned amount, unless any of the creditors or regulatory bodies have submitted a request to commence procedures within the aforementioned period."
And as stipulated in Article 131 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, that "Subject to the provisions stipulated in this Law regarding the request to commence procedures, as well as the cases"

And whereas, regarding the expenses, including legal fees, since the bankruptcy lawsuit <orig>دعوى الإفلاس</orig> is a procedural lawsuit based on guaranteeing the rights of creditors, the court rules to add them to the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 189, paragraph (c) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.

The Court ruled: -
To declare the bankruptcy of both plaintiffs: 1- Winsy General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة وينسي للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> 2- Mohammed Younis Rattām <orig>محمد يونس رطام</orig>, and to set May 27, 2024, as the provisional date for cessation of payments, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and publish its summary in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and announce it in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and take all necessary legal measures regarding the declaration of their bankruptcy, and added the expenses and an amount of twenty dinars <orig>دينار</orig> for legal fees to the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig>.

as specified in the chapter on preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> and the chapter on restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig>, in which the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may issue a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings. The bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payments. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."
And it is stipulated in Article 132 of the same law that "In all cases where the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the bankruptcy commencement application file to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings, and a report on the procedures taken regarding the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence proceedings shall be deposited in the file, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
And it is stipulated in Article 172 of the same law that "The state of bankruptcy shall not arise except by a judgment declaring bankruptcy. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the judgment declaring bankruptcy, announce its operative part, publish it, and disclose it on the Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> if the debtor is listed therein, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on his website and register it as specified in Article 33 of this law, and shall also, within ten days from the date of that judgment, publish its summary and announce it."
Furthermore, it is stipulated in Article 254 of the same law that "The provisions of this law shall generally apply to preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig>, restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig>, and bankruptcy declaration proceedings submitted regarding corporate debts ...."
And it is established that "the trial court <orig>محكمة الموضوع</orig> has full authority to ascertain the facts of the case from its documents, records, and the evidence and presumptions presented, and it may deduce from the facts of the case and the conduct of the litigants the presumptions upon which it relies in forming its conviction, provided that its deduction is reasonable and supported by evidence and grounds firmly established in the documents and leading to the conclusion it reached. The Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> may intervene if the conclusion drawn from those facts does not comply with its legal requirements."
(Appeal 704/2000 Commercial, Session 11/2/2002)

  "publisher": "Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>",
  "page_summary": "This page contains Resolution No. 101 of 2025 from the State Audit Bureau, outlining the duties and performance controls for agents managing seized funds (real estate), based on various laws and a Public Prosecutor's decision regarding money laundering. It details agents' responsibilities, reporting requirements, and conditions for ending their agency."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1734, Seventy-First Year
8A
</header>

- Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980 promulgating the Civil Code.
- Law No. (1) of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds.
- Article (22) of Law No. 106 of 2013 concerning Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing.
- Article (36) of Law No. 2 of 2016 concerning the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority and Provisions for Financial Disclosure.
- Public Prosecutor's Decision No. (2025/17) in Case No. (2022/90) regarding the inventory of money laundering.

- Has Decided -

### Article One
Agents for the management of seized funds (real estate) appointed in accordance with the provisions of Article (24) of the aforementioned Law No. (1) of 1993 shall adhere to the following controls in performing their assigned tasks:
1. The agent shall, in performing their task, adhere to all obligations of an agent according to the provisions of Chapter Two of Part Three of the aforementioned Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980, provided that it does not conflict with the provisions stipulated in this decision or with decisions independently issued by the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig>.
2. The agent shall preserve the funds (real estate) entrusted to their management and must exercise the care of an ordinary person in doing so, as required by the aforementioned provisions of agency.
3. The agent may not delegate all or part of their task to anyone except with written permission from the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>.
4. The agent's authority is limited to acts of management, and they may not undertake any disposition that is not an act of management except with written permission from the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>.
5. The agent may not use the seized funds (real estate) for their own benefit, and it is dangerous for them to deal with the persons whose assets are seized.
6. The agent must refer to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>, as appropriate, regarding all requests or grievances presented to them concerning the seized funds (real estate) which are prohibited from disposition.
7. The agent must disclose any conflicts of interest between themselves and the seized funds (real estate), as well as between themselves and the persons whose assets are seized.
8. The agent must submit to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> every three months an accurate statement of the assigned tasks, including the financial position and its supplementary explanations, a statement of revenues and expenditures for the period covered by the statement, a cumulative statement thereof from the commencement of management until the end of this period, a cash flow statement, and a comprehensive administrative report on the dispositions related to the management of the seized funds (real estate). A copy of the foregoing shall be submitted to the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig> within fifteen days following the end of each period, and the Bureau shall notify the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> and the agent of any observations it deems appropriate.
9. The agent shall continue their management duties until the case is decided or a decision is issued to lift the seizure on the seized funds (real estate).
10. If the agent wishes to terminate their agency, or if their agency terminates for any reason, they must bring the tasks they commenced to a stage where no harm is feared to the funds (real estate) managed by them.

### Article Two
The President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig> may issue a decision with additional specific controls for the performance of work by some agents in cases of seizure that necessitate it, according to the requirements of the interest of the funds (real estate) under management.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force on the day following its publication. All concerned parties shall implement it, each within their respective jurisdiction.

President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig>
Issam Salem Al-Roumi <orig>عصام سالم الرومي</orig>

Issued on: 12 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 10 April 2025 AD

# Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (2025/96)
Regarding the amendment of the name of Manhattan College
in the United States of America on the lists of
the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>
- Having reviewed Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 concerning Civil Service and its amending laws.
- And Amiri Decree No. (417) of 2010 issued on October 25, 2010, concerning the establishment of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (272) issued on October 3, 2012, concerning allowing Kuwaiti students to enroll for study outside the State of Kuwait only in universities for which a ministerial decision is issued by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And Academic Decision No. (2014/25) issued on June 3, 2014, concerning allowing study in Bachelor's and Postgraduate programs in the United States of America.
- And Board of Directors Decision of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (7) issued on December 31, 2014, which includes the mechanism for issuing decisions related to identifying higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait whose graduates' qualifications are permitted to be accredited.
- And Board of Directors Decision of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> (2014/5) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.
- And based on the letter from the Cultural Office in Washington dated January 30, 2025.
- And based on the recommendation of the Committee for Proposing Criteria, Reviewing, and Updating Lists of Higher Education Institutions outside the State of Kuwait <orig>لجنة اقتراح معايير ومراجعة وتحديث قوائم مؤسسات التعليم العالي خارج دولة الكويت</orig> at its third meeting held on March 11, 2025.
- And based on the recommendation of the Director General of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>مدير عام الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And as required by public interest.
(Has decided)
(Article One)
The name of Manhattan College shall be amended to Manhattan University, as stated in Academic Decision No. (2014/25) issued on June 3, 2014, concerning the list of higher education institutions permitted for enrollment to study Bachelor's and Postgraduate programs in the United States of America.
(Article Two)
This decision shall be effective from its date and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبد الله محمد الجلال</orig>

The error was in the procedure: dissolution and liquidation of the company and the legal entity as a limited liability company. The correct procedure is: amendment of the legal entity from: a partnership company to the new legal entity: a limited liability company. Therefore, we are re-publishing the announcement after correcting the error.

The owners of Solidus General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>سوليدس للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out the procedure of: amending the legal entity from a partnership company to the new legal entity: a limited liability company. Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued obligation of the joint partners in the case of a general partnership or simple limited partnership only, in the face of this creditor, until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement of Factory Sale

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> - General Department of Execution - Capital Governorate - Execution File No. (200257630), announces that on Tuesday, 2025/05/27, starting from 10:00 AM, the entire factory known by the trade name "Green Carbon Factory for the Production of Liquid Carbon Dioxide" <orig>مصنع جرين كربون لإنتاج غاز ثاني أكسيد الكربون المسال</orig>, industrial establishment license No. (11960) issued by the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> on 2011/12/14, located in Shuwaikh Industrial Area (Eastern) <orig>منطقة الشعيبية الصناعية (الشرقية)</orig> - Plot No. (16) of Parcel No. (2) with an area of 20000m², will be sold by public auction. This is in execution of Judgment No. 2020/2384 Commercial Civil Government Appeal 9 on 2021/2/16, which became final by virtue of the Consultative Chamber's decision at the Court of Cassation No. 2021/1277 Commercial Cassation 2 on 2022/10/16. The factory is mortgaged in favor of the Industrial Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الصناعي</orig> (the secured creditor) by virtue of Loan Agreement No. 2368, Volume 3, on 2012/9/23, Banking Facilities Agreement No. 612, Volume 3, on 2012/4/28, and Loan Agreement No. 649, Volume 3, on 2015/4/8. This sale is for the factory as a going concern with all its tangible and intangible components and elements, in fulfillment of the bank's debt owed by the debtor/ Green Carbon General Trading Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة جرين كربون للتجارة العامة ذ</orig>.

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the Tax Assessment for Assist BP in A Company
Income Tax for Assist BP in A Company for the Financial Year
Ending on 31/12/2015 - Registration No.: 160687
Having reviewed your tax declaration submitted for the aforementioned financial year, and since the company does not maintain the required accounting books and records under the provisions of Income Tax Decree No. 3 of 1955, as amended by Law No. 2 of 2008, and Article (15) of the Executive Regulations, the Ministry has decided, based on Article (19) of the Executive Regulations, not to rely on your business results and to estimate your profits at 30% of the revenues, as follows:

<table_caption>Financial Assessment Details for Assist BP in A (2015)</table_caption>
<table>
| Description | Amount (Kuwaiti Dinar) |
|:---|:---|
| Revenues according to the tax declaration | 102,334 |
| Net Profit 30% | 30,700 |
| Tax Due 15% | 4,605 |
</table>

The Ministry hopes for prompt payment of the amount due, K.D. 4,605 (only four thousand six hundred and five Kuwaiti Dinars). We refer to the provision of Article Eight of Income Tax Decree No. 3 of 1955, as amended by Law No. 2 of 2008, which stipulates a penalty of 1% for every thirty days or part thereof in case of delayed payment, and Article (24) of the Executive Regulations regarding objection to the tax assessment, which stipulates that a tax objection submitted by the company shall not be considered after sixty days from the date of notification of the assessment letter.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>

# Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
## Announcement

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of Tender No. (DA/129-2024/2025) for the license to exploit, manage, and operate an investment site in Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase Three - (Local Restaurant) (Kiosk F3). Companies or institutions specialized in this field wishing to participate should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and tender documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>), during official working hours, starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 150 only - one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only (K-Net payment only) for the booklet). Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises are exempted from these fees (upon submission of the relevant certificate). This will be effective from Sunday, 13/4/2025, from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:

1.  The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 24/4/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2.  Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7.
3.  Submission of an initial security deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate.
5.  A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company's representative to purchase the tender document.
6.  This tender is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7.  The bidder must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8.  The preliminary meeting and site inspection will be on Monday, 21/4/2025, at 11:00 AM. The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
9.  Must be registered in the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> companies register (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> website)
    /https://pnsd.da.gov.kw/ar

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. (DA/132/2024-2025) for the license to utilize, manage, and operate an investment site in Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig> - Phase Three - a local restaurant and cafe - (Local Chain) Sports Building (Site No. (2)). Those wishing to participate, from companies or institutions specialized in this field, should apply to obtain the booklet of terms and conditions and auction documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone (7) – Tenders and Follow-up Department), during official working hours, starting from the date of publication of the announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (150 K.D.) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K-Net payment only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempted from these fees (upon presentation of the relevant certificate). This will be effective from Sunday, 13/4/2025, from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, subject to the following:

1- The last date for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 24/4/2025. No bids will be accepted after this deadline.
2- Bids shall be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – at Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- Submission of an initial security deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>, in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified cheque from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4- Submission of a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage.
5- An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig> for the company representative to purchase the auction document.
6- This auction is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The bidder must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The preliminary meeting and site visit will be on Sunday, 20/4/2025, at 12:00 PM, at Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig> - Phase Three.
9- The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
10- Companies must be registered with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> website).

# Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>
## Announcement
The Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> announces the opening of registration in the suppliers' register for the fiscal year (2025 – 2026). Companies / establishments wishing to register in the suppliers' register of the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> must send their company / establishment registration documents to the official email of the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> (finance@cpd.gov.kw) in a single file, before the fee payment deadline, as follows:
1.  Copy of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> license.
2.  Copy of the Commercial Register.
3.  Recent certificate from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the file.
4.  Copy of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> registration certificate for 2025.
5.  Copy of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> registration certificate for 2025.
6.  Copy of the Municipality classification and any other classification.
7.  Copy of the company's articles of association (if any).
8.  Statement of contracts and supplies undertaken by the company.
9.  Copy of the signature authorization form.
10. Civil ID number of the company or establishment.
11. Copy of the commercial agency (if any).

- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.

1. A copy of the Civil ID.
2. A copy of the signature authorization for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. If someone other than the authorized signatory attends, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be provided, authorizing the attendee to be present at the session.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises wishing to bid must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.

# National United Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الوطنية المتحدة العقارية</orig> (K.S.C.C.) Closed
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was held on Tuesday, March 25, 2025, at 11:30 AM at the company's management headquarters: Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> Area – Plot 14 – Al-Sour <orig>السور</orig> Street – Al-Hamad <orig>الحمد</orig> Tower B – 12th Floor. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Musaed Yousef Abdul Latif Al-Hamad <orig>مساعد يوسف عبد اللطيف الحمد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Assembly, and attended by:
- Shareholders representing 20,000,000 shares in person and by proxy out of 20,000,000 shares, representing 100%.
- Mr. Fahad Abdul Rahman Al-Badiwi <orig>فهد عبد الرحمن البديوي</orig> representing Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
- Ms. Munira Abdul Latif Abdullah Al-Majed <orig>منيرة عبد اللطيف عبد الله الماجد</orig> representing United Accountants Office <orig>مكتب المحاسبون المتحدون</orig>.
- Mr. Ali Khalid Ali Al-Rashed <orig>علي خالد علي الراشد</orig>, Secretary.
Mr. Musaed Yousef Abdul Latif Al-Hamad <orig>مساعد يوسف عبد اللطيف الحمد</orig> – Chairman of the Session – announced the availability of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly, which was 100% in person and by proxy, and the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly's convening. The Chairman of the Session opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation to attend the meeting. The agenda items were presented and discussed, and the Extraordinary General Assembly approved the following resolutions: -

1) Approval by unanimous attendance to amend Article (25) of the Company's Articles of Association to read as follows:

Thirdly: The amendment of Article No. (46) of the Company's Articles of Association was approved and ratified to become as follows:

#### Text of the Article before amendment:
1. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The General Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a statutory reserve that permits such distribution.
Any amount deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
2. A percentage of 1% (one percent) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
3. Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, as determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
4. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws, and a special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
5. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the General Assembly.

The meeting session was chaired by Mr. Talal Sultan Al-Shehab <orig>طلال سلطان الشهاب</orig> – in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors.

- Mr. Ghazi Jamal Al-Osaimi <orig>غازي جمال العصيمي</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer

- Ms. Nariman Shukri <orig>ناريمن شكري</orig> – representing BDO Al-Nisf & Partners <orig>BDO النصف وشركاه</orig>, the company's auditor

## Held on Wednesday, March 26, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Gas and Oil Fields Services Company – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة خدمات حقول الغاز والنفط – شركة مساهمة كويتية (مقفلة)</orig> held its shareholders' meeting on Wednesday, March 26, 2025, at 1:00 PM, at the company's headquarters in East Ahmadi <orig>شرق الأحمدي</orig> area – Plot 6, Street (1). This meeting was held with the aim of regularizing the company's status and aligning the articles of its Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> with Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>.

The authorized capital of the company may be increased – by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> – based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation.
The capital increase shall be covered by shares whose value is paid by one of the following methods:

2 - Converting funds from the optional reserve, retained earnings, or amounts exceeding the minimum legal reserve into shares.
3 - Converting a debt owed by the company, bonds, or sukuk <orig>صكوك</orig> into shares.

The company shall have the right to carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or through agency.

b – An announcement in at least two daily newspapers published in Arabic. The announcement must be made twice, with the second announcement taking place no less than one week after the date of the first announcement's publication and at least one week before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, with the second announcement published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in addition to the two daily newspapers.

The invitation must include the agenda. The founders shall set the agenda for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting held in its constituent capacity, and the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall set the agenda for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting held in its ordinary and extraordinary capacities.

**Text of the Article after Amendment**
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place specified by the company's articles of association. The Board may invite the Assembly to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must issue an invitation for the Assembly to meet based on a reasoned request from a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning no less than 10% of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>. The inviting party shall prepare the agenda.
The Chairman of the Assembly, the Secretary of the Board of Directors <orig>أمين سر مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and one of the minority shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> present shall record the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and any reservations of the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, if any, endorse them, and submit a report on these resolutions and reservations to the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
The provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, the quorum for attendance, and voting.
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> must invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet within fifteen days if the invitation for the Assembly meeting was not issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for any reason in cases where the Board is required to invite the Assembly to meet.
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall replace the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in taking the necessary measures to hold the meeting and may chair the meeting, unless the Assembly elects one of the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> for this purpose.

Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

## Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (30) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
**Text of the Article before Amendment**
In cases where the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may be convened at the request of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig>, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be prepared by the party requesting the convening of the Assembly, and no matter not included in the agenda may be discussed.

**Text of the Article after Amendment**
In cases where the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may be convened at the request of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig>, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be prepared by the party requesting the convening of the Assembly.
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a supervisory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some of the presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> representing one-quarter of the issued share capital, and the postponed meeting shall be held without the need for new invitation procedures.

Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

## Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (31) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
**Text of the Article before Amendment**
Each shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> shall have a number of votes equal to the number of his shares. Proxy representation is permitted for attending the meeting, and minors <orig>القُصَّر</orig> and interdicted persons <orig>المحجورين</orig> shall be represented by their legal guardians. No member may participate in voting on his own behalf or on behalf of those he legally represents in matters related to his personal interest or a conflict existing between him and the company.

**Text of the Article after Amendment**
Each shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, regardless of the number of his shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> may not vote on his own behalf or on behalf of those he represents in matters related to his personal interest or a conflict existing between him and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> may appoint another person to attend on his behalf. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall issue the rules regulating the disclosures required for special proxies for those attending on behalf of a shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> at the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>.

Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

## Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (32) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
**Text of the Article before Amendment**
Shareholders <orig>المساهمون</orig> shall register their names in a special register prepared for this purpose at the company's headquarters at least twenty-four hours before the scheduled time for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting. The register shall include the shareholder's <orig>المساهم</orig> name, the number of shares he owns, the number of shares he represents, and the names of their owners, along with the submission of the power of attorney <orig>سند الوكالة</orig>. The shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> shall be given an attendance card for the meeting stating the number of votes he is entitled to in person and by proxy, and every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> has the right to attend the Assembly.

**Text of the Article after Amendment**
Every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> registered in the company's shareholders' register with the Clearing Agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> has the right to attend General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings. A shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> may appoint another person to attend on his behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney <orig>توكيل خاص</orig> or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholders' register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the issuing judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court <orig>المحكمة المختصة</orig>, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

## Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (33) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
**Text of the Article before Amendment**
The provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig> shall apply to the quorum required for the valid convening of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in its various capacities and to the majority required for adopting resolutions.

**Text of the Article after Amendment**
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> shall apply to the quorum required for the valid convening of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in its various capacities and to the majority required for adopting resolutions.

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (36) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall convene at least once a year upon the invitation of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months from the end of the company's financial year. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may call for this assembly whenever it deems necessary, and it must call for it whenever requested by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-tenth of the capital. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall also convene if requested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall convene, and invitations to its meetings shall be issued in accordance with the provisions and procedures stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.

Voting Result:
Approved: **60%** Disapproved: **40%**
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (37) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, convened in an ordinary capacity, shall be competent in all matters related to the company's affairs, except for what the law or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> reserve for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in an extraordinary capacity or as a founding assembly.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
a. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, convened in an ordinary capacity, shall be competent in all matters related to the company's affairs, except for what the law or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> reserve for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in an extraordinary capacity or as a founding assembly.
b. The meeting of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or his deputy, or by whomever the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> delegates for that purpose, or by whomever the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> elects from among the shareholders or others.
c. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the memorandum of association, or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must resubmit the violating resolutions to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in a meeting called to discuss the aspects of the violation.

Voting Result:
Approved: **60%** Disapproved: **40%**
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (38) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall submit to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, convened in an ordinary capacity, a report containing a statement on the progress of the company's business, its financial and economic condition, the company's balance sheet, a statement of profit and loss accounts, a statement of the remuneration of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members and auditors' fees, and a proposal for profit distribution, in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meeting, adopt resolutions on matters falling within its competence, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
7. Electing or dismissing Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing the company's auditor, and determining their fees or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9. A report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles <orig>مبادئ المحاسبة الدولية</orig>.

Voting Result:
Approved: **60%** Disapproved: **40%**
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (39) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a written request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> does not invite the assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
a. The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated below.

b. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to convene within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
c. If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> does not invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.
d. The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital.
e. Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Not Approved: 40%

### Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (41) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
#### Text of the Article before Amendment
The following matters shall only be considered by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in an extraordinary capacity:
1- Amending the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the company.
2- Selling the entire project undertaken by the company or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolution, merger, transformation, or division of the company.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
Any amendment to the company's articles shall not be effective except after the approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

#### Text of the Article after Amendment
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall have jurisdiction over the following matters:
1- Amending the company's Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolution, merger, transformation, or division of the company.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective except after taking publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الإشهار</orig>.
The Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> approval must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, its purposes, or its capital, with the exception of increasing capital by issuing shares against profits achieved by the company or as a result of adding reserves - which may be used - to the capital.

### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Not Approved: 40%

### Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (42) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
#### Text of the Article before Amendment
The company shall have one or more auditors <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> from among the chartered accountants <orig>المحاسبين القانونيين</orig>, appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, which shall determine their fees. The auditor shall monitor the accounts of the financial year for which they were appointed.

#### Text of the Article after Amendment
The company shall have one or more auditors <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> from among the chartered accountants <orig>المحاسبين القانونيين</orig>, appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, which shall determine their fees or authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine them. The auditor shall monitor the accounts of the financial year for which they were appointed.

### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Not Approved: 40%

### Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (44) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
#### Text of the Article before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall have the powers and obligations stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig> and Law No. 5 of 1981 on the Practice of the Auditing Profession <orig>قانون مزاولة مهنة مراقبي الحسابات رقم 5 لسنة 1981</orig>. In particular, they shall have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents at any time, and to request any data they deem necessary to obtain. They shall also have the right to verify the company's assets and liabilities. If they are unable to exercise these powers, they shall state this in writing in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and they shall have the right to call the General Assembly for this purpose.

#### Text of the Article after Amendment
a. The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> shall, at all times, have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents, and to request any data they deem necessary to obtain. They shall also have the right to verify the company's assets and liabilities. If they are unable to exercise these rights, they shall state this in writing in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, and the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall be notified thereof.
b. The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> shall be obligated to maintain the confidentiality of the data and information they obtained by virtue of their work with the company, both during and after the termination of their work. They shall not use this data and information to achieve personal gain or for the benefit of others, nor shall they disclose any secrets related to the company. If the auditor violates this, they may be dismissed and held liable for compensation if necessary.
c. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or a number of shareholders representing twenty-five percent of the issued capital may request the replacement of the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> during the financial year. Any decision taken regarding their replacement without following the executive procedures <orig>الإجراءات التنفيذية</orig> specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> shall be void.
d. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may, in exceptional and urgent cases where the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> does not perform their duties for any reason, appoint a replacement, provided that this matter is presented at the first meeting held by the General Assembly for decision.
e. The auditor <orig>مدقق الحسابات</orig> may not be the chairman or a member of the board of directors of the company whose accounts they audit, or be entrusted with any administrative work therein, or supervise its accounts, or be a relative up to the second degree of those who supervise the company's management or accounts. Nor may they buy or sell shares of the companies whose accounts they audit during the auditing period, or perform any consulting work for the company.

### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Not Approved: 40%

### Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (45) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
#### Text of the Article before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall submit a report to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> stating whether the balance sheet <orig>الميزانية</orig> and profit and loss account <orig>حساب الأرباح والخسائر</orig> are consistent with reality and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position <orig>المركز المالي الحقيقي</orig>, whether the company maintains regular accounts <orig>حسابات منتظمة</orig>, whether the inventory <orig>الجرد</orig> has been conducted according to accepted principles, whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report is consistent with what is recorded in the company's books, and whether there have been violations of the company's articles, the law, or international accounting standards <orig>المعايير المحاسبية الدولية</orig> during the financial year in a way that affects the company's activity or financial position, with an indication of whether these violations are still ongoing, within the limits of the information available to them. The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall be responsible for the accuracy of the data contained in their report in their capacity as an agent of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet the obligations of the company under labor laws, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
