Fifth - The necessary amount shall be deducted for the distribution of a first dividend of (5) five percent to shareholders, as determined by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly.
Sixth - After the foregoing, an amount determined by the Ordinary General Assembly shall be deducted, not exceeding (10) ten percent of the remainder, to be allocated for the remuneration of the Board of Directors.
Seventh - The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on the Board of Directors' proposal, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.

### Text of the Article After Amendment
a. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on the proposal of the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company. The General Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
b. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
c. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on the proposal of the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the General Assembly.
d. The General Assembly, based on the proposal of the Board of Directors, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.
e. 1% shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profits.

### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (49) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:

### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The reserve fund shall be used, based on a resolution of the Board of Directors, in what best serves the company's interests. The statutory reserve may not be distributed to shareholders, but it may be used to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders up to (5) five percent in years when the company's profits do not allow for securing this limit. If the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital, the General Assembly may decide to use the excess for purposes it deems beneficial to the company and its shareholders.

### Text of the Article After Amendment
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits. K.S.C. (Closed)
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Wednesday, 26/03/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Kout Food Group Company K.S.C.C. <orig>شركة مجموعة كوت الغذائية ش.م.ك.م</orig> was held at the premises of "Kout Food Group Company, Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> area, Al-Sour <orig>السور</orig> Street, Mr. Yaqoub Al-Humaidhi <orig>يعقوب الحميضي</orig> Building, Third Floor, Meeting Room" at 01:30 PM on Wednesday, March 26, 2025. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Faisal Ali Al-Osaimi <orig>فيصل علي العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Meeting – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, and attended by Mr. Talal Yousef Al-Harbi <orig>طلال يوسف الحربي</orig>, from Deloitte & Touche (Al-Wazzan & Co.) <orig>ديلويت و توش (الوزان و شركاه)</orig>, the company's auditors. After reviewing the attendance percentage of shareholders in person and by proxy, Mr. Faisal Ali Al-Osaimi <orig>فيصل علي العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Meeting – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, announced the availability of the legal quorum for the valid convening of the Extraordinary General Assembly, as the number of shares present in person and by proxy reached 96.381% of the 64,496,907 shares of the company. Mr. Faisal Ali Al-Osaimi <orig>فيصل علي العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Meeting – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to discuss the agenda items. The Chairman of the Meeting read the Board of Directors' report, then presented the agenda items for voting, where the following was approved by unanimous vote of the shareholders present and represented at the meeting:

1.  Approval of the Board of Directors' proposal to reduce the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig> 6,691,869.500 (Six million, six hundred ninety-one thousand, eight hundred sixty-nine Dinars and five hundred Fils) to K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig> 6,678,194.500 (Six million, six hundred seventy-eight thousand, one hundred ninety-four Dinars and five hundred Fils) by an amount of K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig> 13,675 (Thirteen thousand, six hundred seventy-five Dinars) by canceling 136,750 treasury shares owned by the company in its capital, in accordance with the procedures followed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, and authorizing the Chairperson of the Board of Directors and the Chief Executive Officer to take all necessary actions, sign all requests and documents of any nature, and take all necessary measures in this regard.
2.  Approval of the Board of Directors' proposal to amend the text of Article (6) of the Articles of Incorporation and the text of Article (5) of the Articles of Association, as follows, and authorizing the Chairperson of the Board of Directors and the Chief Executive Officer to take all necessary actions, sign all requests and documents of any nature, and take all necessary measures in this regard.

### Article Text Before Amendment

The authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of the company is set at K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig> 6,691,869.500 (Six million, six hundred ninety-one thousand, eight hundred sixty-nine Dinars and five hundred Fils), distributed over 66,918,695 shares (Sixty-six million, nine hundred eighteen thousand, six hundred ninety-five shares) with a par value of one hundred Fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.

### Text After Amendment

The authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of the company is set at K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig> 6,678,194.500 (Six million, six hundred seventy-eight thousand, one hundred ninety-four Dinars and five hundred Fils), distributed over 66,781,945 shares (Sixty-six million, seven hundred eighty-one thousand, nine hundred forty-five shares) with a par value of one hundred Fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.

### Article Text Before Amendment

The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law.

### Text After Amendment

The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its Executive Regulations.

### Voting Result:

Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (53) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:

### Article Text Before Amendment

The liquidation of the company's assets upon its dissolution shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions contained in the Commercial Companies Law.

### Text After Amendment

The liquidation of the company's assets upon its dissolution shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its Executive Regulations.

### Voting Result:

Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (54) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:

### Article Text Before Amendment

The provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. (25) of 2012 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم (25) لسنة 2012</orig> and its amendments contained in Law No. (97) of 2013 <orig>القانون (97) لسنة 2013</orig> and its Executive Regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the company's Articles of Incorporation or Articles of Association, except after the approval of the competent regulatory authorities.

### Text After Amendment

The provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and its Executive Regulations shall apply to all matters specifically provided for in the company's Articles of Incorporation or Articles of Association.

### Voting Result:

Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (69) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:

### Article Text Before Amendment

The founders declare:
*   Firstly – that the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation and the Articles of Association comply with the model stipulated in Article (69) of the Commercial Companies Law.
*   Secondly – that they have subscribed to all shares.
*   Thirdly – that they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies for the management of the company, and the first administrative body of the company shall be selected at the first meeting of shareholders as a founding assembly.

### Text After Amendment

The founders declare:
*   Firstly – that the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation and the Articles of Association comply with the law.
*   Secondly – that they have subscribed to all shares.
*   Thirdly – that they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies for the management of the company, and the first administrative body of the company shall be selected at the first meeting of shareholders as a founding assembly.

### Voting Result:

Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

The meeting concluded at 1:30 PM on the same date of convening.

# Rear Logistics Department <orig>إدارة التجهيز الخلفي</orig>
## Re-Tender Announcement
Tender No.: 15646-2411-8 for the supply of "Mercedes" spare parts
The Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> announces the release of the above-mentioned tender to Gulf companies and establishments specializing in this field for the year 2025, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Rear Logistics Department <orig>إدارة التجهيز الخلفي</orig> – Technical Equipment Control <orig>مراقبة التجهيزات الفنية</orig> during official working hours. Bids must be submitted at the Ministry's headquarters at (01:00 PM) to the Mail and Tenders Delivery Center <orig>مركز تسليم البريد والمناقصات</orig> near Gate No. (12) (Military Materials Procurement Committee and Military Facilities Contracts <orig>لجنة مشتريات المواد العسكرية ومقاولات المنشآت العسكرية</orig>) (Box No. (1) next to the Military Sports Federation <orig>الإتحاد العسكري الرياضي</orig>).

## Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig>) announces the offering of the following practices:

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig> (No. 2). Bids must be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date. The required preliminary insurance is specified in the practice documents and must be valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1) Participation is restricted to companies registered with the Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig>.

3) Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents in cash.
4) A letter of authorization from the company to purchase the practice documents.
5) Participating companies must submit a national labor support certificate.
6) Practice documents can be obtained from the publication date until the closing date.

Minutes of the meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> in its session
held on 23/3/2025, No. 2025/10
After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in the births and deaths registers, the committee decided to publish the following in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within
fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the registers, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:
Member of the meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> in its session
held on 23/3/2025, No. 2025/10
The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.
<table_caption>Births and Deaths Committee Members</table_caption>

|:------|:------|
| Mr. / Director of the Central Registry Department for Births and Deaths <orig>مدير إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> | Chairman |
| Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>رئيس المجلس الطبي العام</orig> | Member |
| Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>رئيسة قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>رئيس قسم القيد</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>رئيس قسم الوفيات</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> | Member |
</table>
Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> acted as the committee's secretary.
The committee reviewed requests from No. ((128)) to No. ((142)) in the attached list concerning data amendments in the births and deaths registers and approved the registration of birth and death.
Therefore, after its review and verification of the completeness of documents and records, the committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues, so that if
the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement has passed and no objection has been submitted, the amendments will be recorded in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the property described below, on Thursday, 8 / 5 / 2025, in Hall 52 – on the second floor of the Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig>, at 9:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2023/102 Sales/3.

Filed by:
1- Masha'el Mubarak Saad Al-Qaba <orig>مشاعل مبارك سعد القبا</orig>.
2- Shu'a'a Mubarak Saad Al-Qaba <orig>شعاع مبارك سعد القبا</orig>.

Against:
1- Sa'da Mohammed Al-Mukhalaf <orig>سعده محمد المخلف</orig>.
2- Director of the Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig>, in his capacity.
3- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, in his capacity.
4- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.

Firstly: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property document No. 1983/3851, located in Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig> area – Block 3 – Plot No. 105 – from plan No. T.M. / 325-2/11-325-3 B – with an area of 750 m2.

Inspection:
During our session on 17/10/2022, we moved to Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig> area, Block 3, Al-Qasr <orig>القصر</orig>, Street 3, Avenue 6, Plot 105, House 2, from plan No. (T.M. / 325-2/11 – 325-3 B), automated number for the disputed property 14266117, to inspect the disputed property on site, in the presence and guidance of the two plaintiffs personally, and with the cooperation of Mr. Sa'ad Mubarak Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد مبارك المطيري</orig>, the expert consulted by the administration at the time of inspection, as follows:
- The disputed property is a beige stone-clad house consisting of a ground floor and a first floor, located on two streets, with adjacent neighbors on the remaining sides. The property has two annexes on the two facades of the house, one from the side street and one from the front street. There is a large setback for the property from the front street and an internal courtyard within the property.
- The disputed property conforms to the general and specific specifications of document No. 3851, registered on 24/4/1983, with an area of 750 m2, as stated in the inheritance ownership proof and mutual relinquishment contract issued by the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, Real Estate Registration and Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig>.
- The ground floor consists of 5 rooms, 3 bathrooms, a kitchen, a large hall, and another hall with a preparatory counter.
- The annex located on the front street consists of 2 rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen, and is rented to others. The two plaintiffs explained its components to the expert.
- The first floor consists of two apartments rented to others. The apartment located on the side street consists of a hall, two rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen. The apartment located on the front street consists of 3 rooms, 2 bathrooms, and a kitchen. The two plaintiffs explained the components of both apartments to the expert.
- The air conditioning in the disputed property is central on the ground floor, and split units and window air conditioning on the first floor and in the annex.
- The expert asked the two plaintiffs about the occupant and possessor of the property subject of the lawsuit. They stated that the first defendant lives there with her son, and her son with his family has been paying them rent in recent years, and there are also other tenants in the property as stated.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start with a base price of / 526,500 K.D. (Five Hundred Twenty-Six Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a deposit of its full value will be considered.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
<page_end>122</page_end>

Filed by: Jameela Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>جميلة محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
Against: The heirs of the deceased / Munira Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>منيره محمد سعد البيدان</orig>, namely:
1- Thamani Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>ثماني محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.

7- Saad Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>سعد محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
8- Khazna Hudaib Marzouq Al-Shafna <orig>خزنه هديب مرزوق الشفناء</orig>.

Firstly: Property Descriptions: According to the attached two description certificates.
The building consists of 4 floors, with 4 identical apartments on each floor. Each apartment comprises (a living room + a bedroom + a bathroom + a kitchen), noting that apartment rents vary from 190-220 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> monthly, as per the plaintiff's agent's statement.
The rooftop is vacant.
Mr. Expert / Al-Khabeer <orig>الخبير</orig> recorded his observations in preparation for estimating the value of the property subject to the lawsuit.
The expert committee / Al-Khibra <orig>الخبرة</orig> delegated the session to move to the next property subject to the lawsuit in Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area, Block 2, Street 81, Plot 31, Automated Number (82231358), in the presence of those who previously attended the inspection of the first property, and the following was observed:
The property is a building located on two streets and a square (wide alley), consisting of a mezzanine / suspended floor <orig>معلق</orig> and 6 identical floors.
The ground floor (mezzanine / suspended floor <orig>المعلق</orig>) contains 4 apartments, detailed as 2 apartments consisting of (a living room + a bedroom + a bathroom + a kitchen).
And one apartment consisting of (a living room + 2 bedrooms + a bathroom + a kitchen) and a studio apartment (
a bedroom + a bathroom + a kitchen).
The ground floor has a shop rented as a salon for a monthly rent of 700 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, as per the plaintiff's agent's statement.
The building consists of 6 floors, each floor containing 4 identical apartments. Each apartment comprises (a living room + 2 bedrooms + a bathroom + a kitchen), noting that apartment rents vary from 210-230 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> monthly, as per the plaintiff's agent's statement.
The rooftop is vacant.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price specified for each property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department / Idarat Al-Tanfeez <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice / Wizarat Al-Adl <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit one-fifth of the price in this session; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was initially awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no other bids are submitted, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense in this session with any offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published according to the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for them, without the Department of Clerks / Idarat Al-Kitab <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court / Al-Mahkama Al-Kulliya <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure / Qanun Al-Murafa'at <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure / Qanun Al-Murafa'at <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure / Qanun Al-Murafa'at <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall be deemed a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Pursuant to the judgment issued in lawsuit No. 159/2023 Sales/3 dated November 23, 2023, the Court ruled, prior to deciding on the merits of the lawsuit, to appoint an auditor (expert) accredited by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023, is KWD 8,581,424 (eight million five hundred eighty-one thousand four hundred twenty-four Kuwaiti Dinars). ## Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the base price indicated in the descriptions. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full price at which the sale was awarded immediately upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding shall be reopened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, calculated by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the sale price of the shares.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for amending the company's articles of association, the expenses of the execution procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office of the General Court <orig>إدارة كتاب المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The partners have the right to object to the joining of the bidder who submitted the best offer within three days from the date of the court's approval of his bid.
Ninth: The company and any of the partners may - even before the issuance of the auction award judgment - settle the partner's debt to the attaching creditor.
Tenth: The company may - even before the issuance of the auction award judgment - redeem a portion of the seized shares to the extent sufficient to satisfy the creditor's debt.

Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>200 د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates any ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 <orig>المادة 266</orig> of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 <orig>المادة 277</orig> of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 <orig>المادة 276</orig> of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

- The basement consists of 18 commercial shops.
- The ground floor consists of 21 commercial shops, 11 of which have an external entrance and an entrance inside the complex.
- The first floor consists of 18 commercial shops.
- There are 7 shops on the external facade of the complex.
- The air conditioning is central, and there is one elevator serving the commercial shops, reaching from the basement to the first floor, in addition to 2 escalators + one staircase reaching only from the ground floor to the basement.
2- The Two Towers
- Each tower has an external entrance and an internal entrance to the commercial shops.
- Each tower consists of 7 floors, and each floor contains 3 duplex offices (two floors).
- There is one elevator for each tower connecting the ground, first, third, fifth, and seventh floors.
- It was found by the expert that the commercial complex is independent and leased as commercial shops. As for the two towers, they are independent and leased as commercial offices. The quarterly rent for the property is (70,450 K.D.).

** The property description certificate <orig>شهادة الأوصاف</orig> indicates a violation:**
After inspection, it was found that the commercial complex consists of a basement + ground floor + mezzanine + first + second + 3-8 floors + roof. There are violations on the right side of the basement, where there are shops that do not conform to the plan. Also, on the front side of the basement, there are four shops instead of one. On the first floor, there is exploitation of distributors, and floors 1-8 also do not conform to the plans, and there is an increase in construction.
** According to the expert's report <orig>تقرير الخبير</orig>**
The property subject of the lawsuit, along with execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D.

## Secondly: Auction Conditions:

Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price associated with the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction award will be ruled in their favor, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session on this basis.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.

*Inspection:
- The disputed property located in Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area – Plot 10 – Street 2 – House 231 – bearing automated number 15009737. The inspection was conducted as follows:
- The property is located on an internal street, flanked on both sides by other properties, and opposite a cooperative society branch.
- The house consists of a ground floor and a first floor, with two large structures built on the roof.
- There are 3 entrances to the house: an entrance for the diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>, an entrance for the ground floor, and a side entrance leading to the stairs and the first floor.
- It was found that the property was previously divided by a prepared division, with the plaintiff utilizing the ground floor and the defendant utilizing the first floor and the diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>.
- It was revealed that the entire ground floor is rented by the plaintiff, as the tenant of the entire floor (this diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>) admitted to paying a monthly rent of 850 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>, but she refused to have her name recorded in Al-Khader <orig>الخضر</orig>.
- The ground floor consists of: a hall + two apartments + a reception hall + washbasins + a bathroom + a kitchen + a maid's room + a laundry room + a courtyard.
The hall floors are ceramic, the ceilings are gypsum board, the wall paint is ordinary, and the maid's room and laundry room floors are tiled.
The first floor consists of: a hall + a kitchen + a storage room + 3 apartments.
The first apartment on the first floor consists of: a corridor with a small preparatory kitchen + two rooms + a bathroom (utilized by the family of the parties' son).
The second apartment on the first floor consists of: two rooms + two bathrooms. (utilized by the family of the parties' daughter).
The rooms in both apartments have parquet flooring, hidden gypsum board ceilings, the corridor floors are marble-colored ceramic, and the walls have ordinary paint.
The hall floors are ceramic, and the wall has hidden gypsum board decor with hidden lighting.
The third apartment on the first floor consists of: a bedroom + a bathroom + an external washbasin. Its floors are ceramic and the ceiling is
ordinary gypsum board. (utilized by the defendant and his wife).
- The kitchen: its floors are ceramic and the walls are decorated with stones and ceramic.
The external stairs are tiled.
The roof has a hall made of Kiri <orig>الكيري</orig> and a preparatory kitchen with a glass facade wall and a glass door leading to an internal garden, where the floors are paved with artificial grass and outdoor seating (chairs and tables) has been placed, utilized by the plaintiff.
There is also a room made of Kiri <orig>الكيري</orig> on the roof for the defendant's son, with a bedroom and a bathroom. Its floors are tiled and the bathroom is ordinary ceramic.
The diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>: a hall + a small washbasin + a small bathroom. Its floors are ceramic, the walls have ordinary paint + old commercial porcelain walls, and it has been utilized as a storage room.
The defendant acknowledged that the house is divisible and that the plaintiff has been benefiting from the ground floor for four years for 850 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> monthly, and that he rents the apartments on the first floor to his children, as the inspection revealed that the first apartment is utilized by the defendant's son and his wife, and the second apartment by the defendant's daughter and her husband.

## Second: Auction Terms and Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the basic price of the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding shall be canceled at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: In the event that the bidder whose offer was approved deposits at least one-fifth of the price, the sale shall be postponed with a ten percent increase.
Fifth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be re-opened in the same session based on this price.
Sixth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be re-opened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Seventh: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication expenses for the sale in daily newspapers.
Eighth: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Ninth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

On 12/6/2022, the dispute site located in Abu Ftaira <orig>أبو فطيرة</orig> area – Plot 6 – Streets 183 and 185 – House 1 – Parcel 340 – Automated No.: 19977823 was visited and inspected on site, in the presence and under the guidance of the defendant's agent, and with the assistance of Mr. Tariq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, the expert of knowledge in the administration, at the time of inspection, as follows:-
The entrance to the dispute site was opened by the defendant's agent, who stated that the defendant and her children currently reside in the property.
The disputed property conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to document No. 2012/12741 and has an area of 462.5 m2.
The disputed property is a corner house located on two streets, bordered by neighbors on two sides.
The disputed property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a quarter floor on the roof, with the following details:
a- The basement consists of 2 storage rooms + a large hall + a room with a bathroom + a bathroom with washbasins + a swimming pool with a shower room + ceramic floors + a sunken courtyard + a hall at the basement entrance serving as a dining room for guests.
b- The ground floor consists of: 2 halls with their facilities and a dining room with marble floors + 3 bathrooms + 2 washbasins + a laundry room with a small room inside it and its bathroom + an office room with its bathroom + a fully equipped kitchen + the ground floor entrance is a large lobby with ceramic flooring and a skylight.
c- The first floor consists of: five master bedrooms with their bathrooms + a lobby between the rooms with wooden parquet floors + a preparatory kitchen.
d- The second floor consists of: 2 halls + 4 rooms with their bathrooms and a corridor + a washbasin with its bathroom + a kitchen + a maid's room with its bathroom + a balcony.
e- The roof consists of: two rooms + a bathroom + a laundry room + a service room.
5- The property's exterior is clad with beige Sigma <orig>سيجما</orig> paint and grey stone.
6- The house has central air conditioning.
7- The house has an elevator from the basement to the roof.
8- There are wooden decorations in various places on the ground floor and in the basement.

First: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.

On 18/4/2024, we moved to the disputed property located in Sabah Al-Ahmad Sea City <orig>صباح الأحمد البحرية</orig> – Block A1, Street 278, with an area of 2518m². The inspection was carried out as follows:
The disputed property is a commercial complex named Mall (278) with an area of 2518m², directly overlooking the sea (south) and one back street (north). It is bordered by a neighbor to the west and a sandy area to the east. It consists of a quarter basement, a ground floor, a mezzanine, and 3 upper floors. It is finished externally with limestone (brown color) and Sigma (white color). It is fully finished and has been connected to electricity for more than a year. There is no active business operating at the time of inspection (it has not been opened). It contains a total of 226 commercial shops for sale (ownership), not for rent, as stated by the agent of the first defendant. The details are as follows:
- **Basement:** Consists of electrical rooms, electrical generators, and unoperated internal storage rooms. It also contains the offices of the property management company (the first defendant), which are approximately 100m².
- **Ground Floor:** Consists of 74 shops with areas ranging from 12m² to 20m², according to the attached plan image.
- **Mezzanine Floor:** Consists of 64 shops with areas ranging from 12m² to 23m², according to the attached plan image.
- **First Floor:** Consists of 32 shops with areas ranging from 30m² to 40m², according to the attached plan image.
- **Second Floor:** Consists of 28 shops with areas ranging from 30m² to 83m², according to the attached plan image.
- **Third Floor:** Consists of 28 shops with areas ranging from 30m² to 61m², according to the attached plan image.
The complex also contains 4 electric elevators (3 regular and 1 panoramic), in addition to 2 escalators connecting to all floors except the basement. There is a large glass skylight in the middle of the complex overlooking all floors except the basement. All corridors and public areas are finished, and the commercial shops are not operated internally, but each shop has a connected air conditioning unit. The real estate expert inspected the property and estimated its value as land and buildings as shown below.

Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: Whoever's bid is approved and deposits the full price must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened on their account in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction award judgment shall be issued in their favor, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit of the auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened on their account based on the price at which it was awarded in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates any ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

** The founders acknowledge their legal capacity to establish a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (Al-Sayer Privileges Holding Company <orig>شركة امتيازات الساير القابضة</orig>) among themselves and their commitment to the rules stipulated for its establishment in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations. They also acknowledge their commitment to all rules stipulated for the establishment of the company in accordance with the provisions of the following articles: -

### Article (1)
The preceding preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.

### Article (2)
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, its executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract. The company shall acquire legal personality from the date of registration. It shall not be permitted to commence its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in the activity.

### Article (3)
Company Name / Al-Sayer Privileges Holding Company <orig>شركة امتيازات الساير القابضة</orig> and its trade name is a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company.

### Article (4)
The company's head office is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its domicile is in the State of Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>. The company may transfer its head office to any other location within Kuwait, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait. The company shall directly conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes. The company's headquarters shall be considered the legal domicile for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it, and its data shall be recorded in the Commercial Register. Any change to this headquarters shall not be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register.

### Article (5)
The company's duration is unlimited, commencing from the date of registration.

### Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning companies and its amendments – and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1 - Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2 - Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3 - Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation percentage in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20 percent.
4 - Owning intellectual property rights, including patents,

Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal (may be owned) by non-Kuwaitis in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating thereof.
Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the date of its implementation, provided that the increase in the issued capital, within the limits of the authorized capital, is by a resolution of the company's Board of Directors, and provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly after the approval of the regulatory authorities, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors and a report from the auditor in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

Article (9)
The company's capital is set at KWD 2,400,000 – two million four hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only.

If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amount.
In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law.

Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription, as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (11)

1. Requiring a pre-emptive right for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2. Requiring the Board of Directors' approval for the share purchasers.

Establishment of the Company
A - Elements of the Company's Establishment
Article (1)
The company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations, and these Articles of Association, between the owners of the shares whose provisions are set forth hereinafter, as a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.) <orig>ش.م.ك.م</orig>.
Article (2)
The company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait, which is the domicile to be relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is registered in the Commercial Register. The Board of Directors may establish branches, agencies, or offices for it in the State of Kuwait or abroad.
Article (3)
The duration of this company is unlimited and commences from the date of its registration.
Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1 - Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2 - Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its business within the limits permitted by law.
3 - Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20 percent.
4 - Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others.
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent. The company may also engage in activities that are common, complementary, necessary, or related to its stated purposes.

### Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association is adopted)
Before disposing of his shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

### Article (13)
(Mandatory text if the second restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in the event of its refusal of the buyer's person, must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date of notifying the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell his shares.

### Article (14)
Subscription

### Article (14)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with shares totaling (2,400,000) (two million four hundred thousand shares), with a nominal value of (one Dinar), distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. An amount of (2,400,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) (only two million four hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig>, as per the attached bank certificate dated 06/08/2024 AD.

### Article (15)
Ownership of a share inevitably entails the shareholder's acceptance of the provisions of the company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (16)
Each share entitles its owner to a share equal to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (17)
The company shall have a special register kept by a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each of them, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded therein shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

### Article (18)
Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must call for the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If this period expires without the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period, call for the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

### Article (20)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Announcement, which must be made twice, with the second announcement taking place at least seven days after the date of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, time, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> for this purpose.

### Article (21)
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees. A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

### Article (22)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information about all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be made available at a location specified by the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

### Article (23)
The Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1. Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3. Electing the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4. Appointing the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5. Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must publish the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

Rights and Obligations of Shareholders

2. Participating in the management of the company through membership in the Board of Directors and attending general assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3. Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4. Disposing of the shares owned by him and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5. Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after fulfilling its debts.

### Article (25)
A member of the company is particularly obligated to the following:
1. Paying the installments due on the shares he owns upon their due dates and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2. Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of the value of his shares. The company has the right to execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3. Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly.
4. Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

### Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders may not do the following:
1. Increasing the shareholder's financial burdens or increasing the nominal value of the share.
2. Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
3. Imposing new conditions other than those mentioned in the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in general assemblies.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

### Article (27)
A- Board of Directors
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five (5) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.

### Article (28)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> may stipulate that no more than half of the first Board of Directors members shall be elected from among the company's founders.

### Article (29)
The Board of Directors shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other powers specified in the Articles of Association <orig>العقد</orig>. His signature shall be considered the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relations with third parties. He must implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers. The Board of Directors shall have the broadest powers to manage the company and perform all actions required for the company's management,

in accordance with its objectives. This authority shall only be limited by what is stipulated by law, these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>, or the resolutions of the General Assembly. The Board of Directors may sell any of the company's assets and real estate, as well as mortgage them, provide guarantees, conclude loans, make donations, grant releases, engage in arbitration, conciliation, and approve control participations.

### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors from among its members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall define his powers and authorities to sign on behalf of the company.

### Article (31)
The Board of Directors may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

### Article (32)
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who are represented on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members. The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

### Article (33)
A Board of Directors meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication means, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during the year. A greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

### Article (34)
Minutes of Board of Directors meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary. Any member who did not approve a resolution taken by the Board may record his objection in the meeting minutes.

### Article (35)
If a Board of Directors member position becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall only complete the term of his predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call for a General Assembly of Shareholders meeting within two months from the date the last position became vacant, and the General Assembly shall elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

### Article (36)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for Board of Directors membership:
1. Must possess legal capacity to act.
2. Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a custodial sentence or a bankruptcy offense.
