3. To personally own or for the person representing him to own (20,000) (twenty thousand) shares of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

### Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors shall not be included in the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

### Article (38)
The chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, or anyone representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these bylaws.

### Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management, otherwise they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

### Article (40)
The chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or conduct for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from them or to consider the operations they conducted for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly.

### Article (41)
The total remuneration of the chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the chairman of the Board of Directors and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for such remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph.
By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly, an independent member of the Board of Directors may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members).
The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the company's Ordinary General Assembly for approval, which shall accurately include a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages obtained by the Board of Directors, regardless of their nature or designation.

### Article (42)
No person representing on the Board of Directors, or the chairman, or a member of the Board of Directors, or a member of the executive management, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly.

### Article (43)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members, the CEO, their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good-faith third parties.
(This provision does not apply to companies authorized to lend)

### Article (44)
The chairman and members of the Board of Directors are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, and for any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or for errors in management.
A vote by the General Assembly to discharge the Board of Directors shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on General Assembly resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those concerning a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute existing between them and the company.

### Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that established the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

### Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

### Article (47)
Every shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to be awarded compensation if warranted. A shareholder may file their personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

B – General Assembly
The Ordinary Annual General Assembly shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may invite the General Assembly to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly to meet upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party.
The provisions related to the Constituent Assembly stipulated in Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> No. 1 of 2016 and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly and the quorum for attendance and voting.

### Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote for themselves or for whom they represent on matters related to their special interest, or a dispute existing between them and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or authorization.

A meeting shall be called to discuss aspects of the violation.
Any person claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholders' register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition <orig>أمر على عريضة</orig> to deprive the disputed shares of voting rights for a period specified by the judge issuing the order, or until the dispute is settled by the competent court <orig>المحكمة المختصة</orig>, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

## Article (50)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, his deputy, a person delegated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for that purpose, or a person elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> from among the shareholders or others.

## Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meetings, take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1.  The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2.  The auditor's <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> report on the company's financial statements.
3.  A report on any violations detected by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4.  The company's financial statements.
5.  The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6.  Discharging the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7.  Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remuneration.
8.  Appointing the company's auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات الشركة</orig>, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9.  Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig>, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards.

## Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.
If a resolution is issued to dissolve the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either that the existing Board continues to manage the company's affairs until the new Board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee <orig>لجنة إدارية مؤقتة</orig> whose primary task is to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new Board, within one month of its appointment.

## Article (53)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>إحدى الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be adjourned for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>. The adjourned meeting shall convene without the need for new invitation procedures.

## Article (54)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must re-present the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> at

## Article (55)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (56)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig> or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall call for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (57)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>.
Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

## Article (58)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1.  Amending the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2.  Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3.  Dissolving, merging, transforming, or splitting the company.
4.  Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

## Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until registration procedures <orig>إجراءات الشهر</orig> are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

## Article (60)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of association <orig>عقد تأسيس الشركة</orig>, or these regulations, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation if necessary.
Furthermore, resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>, provided they were not among those who approved those resolutions.

## Article (61)
For the Closed Company <orig>الشركة المقفلة</orig>
The company shall be liable – jointly and severally <orig>على سبيل التضامن</orig> – for the debts of its subsidiary partners <orig>شركائها التابعة</orig> if the following conditions are met:
1.  Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> funds to meet its obligations.
2.  The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> capital that
<page_end>155</page_end>

The subsidiary company makes decisions or takes actions that target the interest of the owning and controlling company and harm the interest of the subsidiary company or its creditors, and is the main reason for the subsidiary company's inability to fulfill its obligations, unless the closed company is responsible for the subsidiary company's debts based on another reason.

### Article (62)
The company's fiscal year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the commercial register and ends on December 31st of the following fiscal year.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may stop this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to secure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Additionally, (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

### Article (64)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, to be determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for the decrease in their value. These funds shall be used to purchase materials, machinery, and facilities necessary for their repair, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (65)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor laws and social insurance laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for the purposes determined by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig>.

### Article (67)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits and in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. This distribution is not permitted unless it covers the company's paid-up capital.

### Article (68)
Auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments shall apply.

### Article (69)
At the end of each fiscal year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its subsidiaries, accompanied by explanations and data as required by International Accounting Standards <orig>المعايير المحاسبية الدولية</orig>.

### Article (70)
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as set forth in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or in these Bylaws <orig>النظام</orig>.

### Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

### Article (74)
The founders declare the following:
Firstly: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the company's disposal.
Secondly: That the in-kind allocation <orig>المخصص العيني</orig> has been valued in accordance with the provisions of the law, and has been fully paid.
Thirdly: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies for the management of the company.
Fourthly: Preservation of the supporting papers and documents for the aforementioned declarations with the official editor.

### Article (75)

They also affirm their commitment to all established rules for the company's incorporation in accordance with the provisions of the following articles:

### Article (1)

The preceding preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.

### Article (2)

The founders affirm that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, its executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract.
The company shall acquire legal personality from the date of its registration.
The company may not commence its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in the activity.

### Article (3)

Company Name: Haya Holding Company <orig>شركة هيئة القابضة</orig> - A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company.

### Article (4)

The company's principal office is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its domicile is in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The partners may transfer the principal office to any other location within Kuwait, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes. The company's headquarters shall be its legal domicile, which shall be relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it, and its data shall be recorded in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>. Any change to this headquarters shall not be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.

### Article (5)

The company's duration is unlimited, commencing from the date of registration.

### Article (6)

Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning companies, its amendments, and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1. Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2. Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3. Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation percentage in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
4. Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiaries and others.
The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.

### Article (7)

The company's fiscal year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year. The first fiscal year is an exception, commencing from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ending in December of the following fiscal year.

### Article (8)

The company's authorized capital is set at (2,100,000 KWD) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only, distributed over (Twenty-One Million) shares, with a par value of (One Hundred Fils) per share. All shares are (cash shares). The issued capital is (2,100,000 KWD) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only. The company's capital consists of cash shares fully paid by the company at the National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig> as per the letter issued on 19/1/2025.

### Article (11)

The founders signing this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures to complete the establishment of the company and commit to excluding and canceling fictitious and repeated subscription requests and taking the necessary measures to achieve this.
For this purpose, they have appointed Mr. Riad Abdullah Hamad Al-Khaled <orig>رياض عبد الله حمد الخالد</orig> to take legal actions, complete the necessary documents, and introduce any amendments that official authorities deem necessary to be included in the contract or its attached Articles of Association.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the constituent assembly meeting, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed by each founder, their payment details for due installments, their names, addresses, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (12)

The company's founders shall be jointly and severally liable for compensating any damage incurred by the company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the company's contract.

### Article 1

Kaimina Holding Company <orig>كيمينه القابضة</orig>
Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.)
Closed Company
Articles of Association
Establishment of the Company
A- Elements of Company Establishment

### Article (1)

The company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations, and these Articles of Association, among the shareholders whose provisions are specified hereinafter, as a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.).

### Article (2)

The company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is the address considered valid for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile shall not be recognized unless it is registered in the Commercial Register. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may establish branches, agencies, or offices for the company within the State of Kuwait or abroad.

### Article (3)

The duration of this company is unlimited and commences from the date of registration.

### Article (4)

The purposes for which the company was established are: without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
1- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2- Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3- Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation percentage in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
4- Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others.

### Article (5)

B- Capital and Methods of Increasing It

The authorized capital is set at (K.D. 2,100,000) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars), the issued capital at (K.D. 2,100,000) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars), and the paid-up capital at (K.D. 2,100,000) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars). The company's issued capital consists of 21,000,000 cash shares with a value of K.D. 2,100,000 (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars), which have been fully paid.

### Article (6)

The company's shares are nominal (it is not permissible) for non-Kuwaitis to own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial decisions regulating this.

### Article (7)

The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation. However, a decision may be issued by the Board of Directors to increase the issued capital within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

### Article (8)

If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the authorized capital of the company may be increased by a decision issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after the approval of the regulatory authorities, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor in this regard, provided that the decision to increase the capital specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

### Article (9)

The company's capital is set at K.D. 2,100,000 - Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

If it is decided to increase the company's capital and some shareholders do not exercise their priority right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those shareholders of the company who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of offered shares, they shall be allocated to the subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amounts.
In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders. Unsubscribed new shares shall be considered canceled by operation of law.

### Article (10)

Optional Text
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following restrictions:
1- Requiring a right of priority for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2- Requiring the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> approval for the share purchaser.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are exempted from these two restrictions.

## Article (11)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association is adopted)
The shareholder must, before disposing of their shares, notify the company of the sale, or the disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

## Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the second restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors, in the event of rejecting the buyer, must purchase the shares for the company's account within ten days from the date the Board is notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

## Article (13)
### Subscription
The founders who signed the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with shares totaling 21,000,000.00 shares (twenty-one million shares), with a nominal value of KWD 2,100,000.00 (two million one hundred thousand KWD), distributed among them each in proportion to the subscription in the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. KWD 2,100,000 (two million one hundred thousand KWD) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to the National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig> pursuant to the attached bank certificate dated 19/01/2025 AD.

## Article (14)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and the provisions of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the company and the resolutions of its general assemblies.

## Article (15)
Each share grants its owner the right to a share equal to that of others without discrimination in the ownership of the company's assets and in distributed profits.

## Article (16)
The company shall maintain a special register with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by them, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the registered data shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register in accordance with the data received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

## Article (17)
### Constituent Assembly
The founders must, within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each of them, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

## Article (18)
The founders must call for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If the period expires without the Assembly convening, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period, call for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

## Article (19)
The invitation to attend the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall include the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, and one of the following methods:
1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2- Advertisement, which must be published twice, with the second advertisement published after a period of no less than seven days from the date of the first advertisement's publication and at least seven days before the meeting.
3- Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4- Any other modern communication means specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall be chaired by whomever the Assembly elects for this purpose.

## Article (20)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders entitled to vote representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation for the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

## Article (21)
The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location designated by the founders for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

## Article (22)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1 / Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and compliance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2 / Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3 / Electing the members of the first Board of Directors.
4 / Appointing the auditor and determining their fees.
6 / Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The first Board of Directors must publish the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

## Article (23)
### Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1 / Receiving profits and obtaining their shares that are decided for distribution.
2 / Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors and attending general assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3 / Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.

4 / Disposing of shares owned by him and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5 / Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

### Article (24)
A member of the company is particularly obligated to:
1 / Pay the installments due on the shares he owns when they become due and pay compensation for late payment.
2 / Pay the expenses incurred by the company in collecting unpaid installments of the value of his shares, and the company may execute on the shares to recover its rights.
3 / Implement the decisions issued by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of the company.
4 / Refrain from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and be obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

### Article (25)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of shareholders may not do the following:
1 / Increase the financial burdens of the shareholder or increase the nominal value of the share.
2 / Decrease the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's contract.
3 / Impose new conditions other than those mentioned in the articles of incorporation or this system, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written acceptance of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's contract.

### Article (26)
A - Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> consisting of (5) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is elected.

### Article (27)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot. The company's contract may stipulate that no more than half of the initial Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members be elected from among the company's founders.

### Article (28)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect a Chairman <orig>رئيساً للمجلس</orig> and a Vice Chairman <orig>نائباً للرئيس</orig> by secret ballot. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> represents the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the contract. His signature is considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relationship with others, and he must implement the Board's decisions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> replaces the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (29)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from others, entrusted with the management of the company. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> shall define his competencies and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

### Article (30)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may also delegate one of its members or a committee from among its members or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, or to supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or to exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board <orig>المجلس</orig>.

### Article (31)
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as the elected members.
The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

### Article (32)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication means and decisions may be taken by circulation with the approval of all Board <orig>المجلس</orig> members.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least four times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

### Article (33)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر المجلس</orig>. A member who did not approve a decision taken by the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may record his objection in the meeting minutes.

### Article (34)
If a position of a member on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the most votes among the shareholders who did not win membership on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If he is prevented, he shall be succeeded by the next in line. The new member shall complete only the term of his predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of shareholders to convene within two months from the date of the last position becoming vacant, and elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

### Article (35)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
1 - Must have legal capacity to act.
2 - Must not have been previously convicted of a felony <orig>جناية</orig> with a freedom-restricting penalty, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud <orig>إفلاس بالتقصير أو التدليس</orig>, or a crime against honor or trust <orig>جريمة مخلة بالشرف أو الأمانة</orig>, or a freedom-restricting penalty due to violating the provisions of the law, unless his rehabilitation has been restored.
<page_end>160</page_end>

3 - The person, or their representative, must personally own (7500 shares) of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

### Article (36)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234). A person may be the chairman of the Board of Directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

### Article (37)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these bylaws.

### Article (38)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

### Article (39)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. The company may demand compensation from them or consider the operations they carried out for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

### Article (40)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until profits are achieved that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, independent members of the Board of Directors may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members).
The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> for approval, which must accurately include a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors, regardless of their nature or designation.

### Article (41)
Neither a representative on the Board of Directors, nor the Chairman, nor a member of the Board of Directors, nor a member of the executive management, nor their spouses, nor their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

### Article (42)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members, the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, their spouses, their relatives up to the second degree, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good-faith third parties.

### Article (43)
The Chairman and members of the Board of Directors are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, and for any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or for errors in management.
A vote by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the initiation of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions related to their discharge from performance liability, or those concerning a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute existing between them and the company.

### Article (44)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that established the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

### Article (45)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

### Article (46)
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party for compensation to be awarded to it if warranted. A shareholder may file their personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage, and any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

## B - The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>

### Article (47)
The Ordinary Annual General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be determined, and the provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for calling the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and the quorum for attendance and voting.
<page_end>161</page_end>

## Article (48)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of shares they own, has the right to attend the General Assembly. They shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares, and a shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of those they represent in matters related to a special interest of theirs, or a dispute existing between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization provided by the company for this purpose.
Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholders' register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition <orig>أمر على عريضة</orig> to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

## Article (49)
Optional Text
Voting for candidates for membership of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be subject to the cumulative voting system, which grants each shareholder voting power equal to the number of shares they own, whereby they are entitled to cast all their votes for one candidate or distribute them among the candidates they choose, without duplicating these votes.

## Article (50)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or their deputy, or a person delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or a person elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

## Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in its annual meeting shall be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
- 1 The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
- 2 The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
- 3 A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
- 4 The company's financial statements.
- 5 The Board of Directors' proposals regarding profit distribution.
- 6 Discharging the members of the Board of Directors.
- 7 Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors and determining their remuneration.
- 8 Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
- 9 Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles.

## Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
If a resolution is issued to dissolve the Board of Directors, and it is not possible to elect a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either for the existing board to continue managing the company's affairs until a new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee whose primary task shall be to convene the General Assembly to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

## Article (53)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or were discovered during the meeting, or if requested by one of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be adjourned for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued capital. The adjourned meeting shall be held without the need for new invitation procedures.

## Article (54)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors must present the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting convened to discuss the aspects of the violation.

## Article (55)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (56)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors fails to invite the General Assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (57)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital. Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

## Article (58)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
- 1 Amending the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
- 2 Selling the entire project for which the company was established, or disposing of it in any other way, or dissolving the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.

4 - Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until the publication procedures have been completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

Article (60)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit to nullify any resolution issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly that violates the law, the company's articles of association, or these regulations, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation when necessary.
Resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies that prejudice the rights of the minority may also be challenged. Such challenges shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital, provided they did not approve those resolutions.

Article (61)
For the Holding Company
The company shall be jointly and severally liable for the debts of its subsidiary companies if the following conditions are met:
1 - Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's funds to meet its obligations.
2 - The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary company's capital that enables it to control the appointment of the majority of the members of the Board of Directors or managers, or the decisions issued by the management.
3 - The subsidiary company takes decisions or performs actions that target the interest of the owning and controlling company and harm the interest of the subsidiary company or its creditors, and these actions are the main reason for the subsidiary company's inability to meet its obligations.
All of the above applies unless the holding company is liable for the subsidiary company's debts based on another reason.

Article (62)
Company Accounts
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and ends on December 31st of the following financial year.

Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may not stop this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.

Article (64)
Annually, a percentage of 5% shall be deducted from the gross profits, or a percentage determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

Article (65)
The General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for the purposes determined by the Assembly.

Article (67)
The General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and this distribution must not affect the company's paid-up capital.

Article (68)
Auditor
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments shall apply.

Article (69)
At the end of each financial year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its subsidiary companies, accompanied by explanations and data as required by international accounting standards.

Article (70)
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as specified in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of association or in these regulations.

Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's main office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

## Announcement of Company Registration for the Year 2025

As an approved supplier in the State Audit Bureau's <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> suppliers' register

The State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> announces the opening of electronic registration for companies as approved suppliers in the Bureau's suppliers' register. Therefore, companies wishing to register are requested to attend the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> / Financial Affairs Department / Budget Section <orig>قسم الميزانية</orig>) with the company details form (after electronically registering the company on the Bureau's official website). Company registration will not be approved until a fee of 5 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> is paid. The payment receipt and registration form must be submitted to the Procurement Department for the company to be approved as a supplier for the current calendar year, renewable annually for the same fee.

*   Note: Follow the official website of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> (www.sab.gov.kw) for any updates.
*   To register: Go to the Bureau's Homepage <-- Electronic Services <-- For Companies <-- Registration <-- The form can be downloaded after completing all data.
For inquiries, please contact the following number: 24957346

## Supreme Council for Planning and Development / Al-Majlis Al-A'la lil-Takhteet wal-Tanmiya <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>
Announcement
The General Secretariat / Al-Amanah Al-Ammah <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> announces its desire to issue Practice No. (2024/9-2025) for the maintenance of devices and systems in the halls of the General Secretariat building of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development / Al-Majlis Al-A'la lil-Takhteet wal-Tanmiya <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>. Companies wishing to apply for this practice must observe the following:
1. Be registered with the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development and listed with the Central Agency for Public Tenders / Al-Jihaz Al-Markazi lil-Munakasat Al-Ammah <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> before the issuance of this announcement.
2. The applying company must have experience in this field, with proof thereof.
3. The General Secretariat will begin issuing the practice terms starting from the date of publication of the announcement and for a period of ten working days.
4. The practice terms can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department / Idarat Al-Shu'un Al-Maliyah <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> for a fee of -- /75 K.D. (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars only).
5. A preliminary meeting with the bidders will be held on Wednesday, 16/4/2025, at 10:00 AM in the General Secretariat building of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development.
6. Offers must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Financial Affairs Department by 1:00 PM on Thursday, 24/4/2025.

7- The initial guarantee for the practice, valued at (2%), must be attached to the bid in the form of a certified cheque or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, unconditional, and valid for at least (90) days from the last date for receiving bids.
8- Attach a certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
9- Attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the private sector, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.

Report on Bankruptcy Proceedings and Provisional List of Debts

Pursuant to the judgment issued in Case No. 2012/24 Public Debts Bankruptcy/1
dated 8/2/2012, which declared the bankruptcy of the bankrupt / Mohammed Hussein Ali Mahmoud <orig>محمد حسين علي محمود</orig>, whereby
the judgment became final and acquired the force of res judicata.
And whereas the managing bank (Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig>) stated in its letter dated
23/9/2019 that the indebtedness of the aforementioned bankrupt amounts to K.D. 352,759.158
as of 1/8/1990, given that the value of the indebtedness mentioned in the bankruptcy declaration judgment
amounting to K.D. 405,818.843 is as of 31/12/1991 and not as
of 1/8/1990, considering that the error in the judgment is a material error, while the data related
to the value of the indebtedness from its beginning to its current time are correct.
Based on the foregoing and in deference to the authority of judgments, the Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> in its capacity as "
the "Trustee" relies on what was stated in the bankruptcy declaration judgment, as the Authority, in its capacity,
submitted a report on the bankruptcy proceedings and the provisional list of debts for the aforementioned bankrupt to
the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> by its letter dated 24/2/2025, whereupon a decision was issued approving

recent workforce <orig>العاملة</orig> that includes the absence of any suspension on the company's file regarding government contracts registered with the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, and a certificate of 'to whom it may concern' stating the fulfillment of the national labor percentage <orig>نسبة العمالة الوطنية</orig> with a recent date contemporary to the tender date. The practitioner <orig>الممارس</orig> must also deposit with their bid an initial security <orig>تأميناً أولياً</orig> in the form of a certified check or an unconditional and irrevocable letter of guarantee, free from any reservations, issued in the name of the bidder by one of the banks accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and in favor of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid. Any bid not accompanied by the full amount of this security will be excluded. The initial security may not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the date of closing the practice <orig>الممارسة</orig> or when the winning practitioner signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this security, and the practitioner's creditors may not seize its amount, noting that this practice is indivisible.

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that the Allocation Committee <orig>لجنة التخصيص</orig>, in its meeting No. (2025/3) held on 2023/3/13, decided to cancel craft license <orig>الترخيص الحرفي</orig> No. 25757 issued to Mr. / Ali Hassan Abdul Rahim <orig>علي حسن عبد الرحيم</orig> and to withdraw the craft units <orig>الوحدات الحرفية</orig> within 10 days from the date of this announcement and hand them over to the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>. Otherwise, the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> will be compelled to take its removal procedures at the expense of the concerned party <orig>صاحب العلاقة</orig>, without prejudice to the Authority's right to claim any other compensation from the concerned parties resulting therefrom.

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that the heirs of Mr. / Mohammed Ahmed Al-Jassim <orig>محمد أحمد الجاسم</orig> have applied for a replacement for the lost plot contract <orig>عقد القسيمة</orig> No. (66), Plot 3, in Al-Mirqab Industrial Area 2 <orig>منطقة المرقاب الصناعية 2</orig>. Anyone in possession of the aforementioned plot contract or having any information regarding it is requested to come forward to the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> headquarters (Ground Floor), Licenses and Industrial Register Department <orig>قسم التراخيص والسجل الصناعي</orig>, within two weeks from the date of publication of this announcement. Consequently, the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> will issue a replacement for the requested contract after the expiration of the deadline.

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that the heirs of Mr. / Mohammed Ahmed Al-Jassim <orig>محمد أحمد الجاسم</orig> have applied for a replacement for the lost plot contract <orig>عقد القسيمة</orig> No. (78), Plot 3, Al-Mirqab Industrial Area 2 <orig>المرقاب الصناعية 2</orig>. Anyone in possession of the aforementioned plot contract or having any information regarding it is requested to come forward to the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> headquarters (Ground Floor), Licenses and Industrial Register Department <orig>قسم التراخيص والسجل الصناعي</orig>, within two weeks from the date of publication of this announcement. Consequently, the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> will issue a replacement for the requested contract after the expiration of the deadline.

## Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>

### Announcement

The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the individuals whose names are listed below have had their residential addresses removed from its records (based on the declaration of the property owner <orig>مالك السكن</orig> or due to building demolition <orig>هدم المبنى</orig>). These individuals must visit the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> to register a new address (after providing supporting documents <orig>الوثائق الثبوتية</orig>) within thirty days from this date. Otherwise, they will be subject to the penalty stipulated in Article (33) of Law No. 32 of 1982 <orig>القانون رقم 32 لسنة 1982</orig>, a fine not exceeding one hundred dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, which multiplies with the number of individuals.
