This will take place at the headquarters of the Bayt al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department, affiliated with the Administration, located in Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> on the Sixth Ring Road.
Therefore, those wishing to purchase should attend the auction site on the specified date, taking into account the following terms of sale:
1. The Auction Sale Committee has the right to sell the goods in one transaction or several transactions, depending on the circumstances of the sale.
2. The successful bidder shall bear a brokerage commission of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder must pay the value of the goods only via K-net, according to the assessment of the Auction Sale Committee.
4. The successful bidder must remove the goods from the headquarters of the Bayt al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
6. The Administration has the right to stop, postpone, or reschedule the sale at another time if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interests.
7. The Auction Sale Committee may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
8. Since the goods will be sold as-is, bidders must inspect them to verify their condition, quality, and type at the address mentioned above during the auction sale.

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the Expiry of the Initial Approval Period for the Establishment of a Company Engaging in Securities Activities
The Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> announces the expiry of the initial approval period granted to the founders of a company under establishment on 06/04/2025, in accordance with Resolution No. (134) of 2024 concerning the initial approval for the establishment of a closed company engaging in securities activities, issued on 07/10/2024, by the following individuals:

<table_caption>Capital Markets Authority - Company Founders and Ownership Percentages</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Name | Nationality | Ownership |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | WB MENA Holding Limited <orig>شركة دبليو بي مينا هولدينج ليمتد</orig> | United Arab Emirates | 84% |
| 2 | Seldon Investments Limited (Jordan) Private Shareholding <orig>شركة سيلدون للاستثمارات ليمتد (الأردن) مساهمة خاصة</orig> | Jordan | 4% |
| 3 | Seldon Investments Limited <orig>شركة سيلدون الفينستيمينس ليمتد</orig> | British Virgin Islands | 4% |
| 4 | Windsor Brokers International Limited <orig>شركة وندسور بروكرز انترناشونال ليمتد</orig> | Seychelles | 4% |
| 5 | Windsor Global Markets Limited <orig>شركة وندسور جلوبال ماركتس ليمتد</orig> | British Virgin Islands | 4% |
</table>

Accordingly, the application for licensing securities activities submitted by the aforementioned founders of the company shall be deemed null and void as of the expiry date of the initial approval on 06/04/2025, in accordance with the provisions of Article 1-7 of Book Five (Securities Activities and Registered Persons) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities and their amendments, which stipulates the following:
"In the event that the applicant fails to submit the required documents and information within the period specified by the Authority in the notification, without an acceptable excuse from the Authority, the application shall be deemed null and void."

# General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
Announcement

A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on Wednesday, corresponding to (2025/4/23), at (eleven o'clock in the morning).
Documents must be returned after being filled out, with the required supporting documents attached, and an initial security deposit of no less than (2%) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security deposit will not be considered, even if they conform to the specifications. The security deposit must be valid for the required bid validity period. Documents must be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax. Bids will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Department) at the General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
Please note that the last day for submitting bids is (Wednesday), corresponding to (2025/4/30), at (one o'clock in the afternoon). Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

(seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only, provided that payment is made via (k.net).
A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on Tuesday, corresponding to (2025/4/22), at (eleven o'clock in the morning).
Documents must be returned after being filled out, with the required supporting documents attached, and an initial security deposit of no less than (2%) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security deposit will not be considered, even if they conform to the specifications. The security deposit must be valid for the required bid validity period. Documents must be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax. Bids will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Department) at the General Directorate of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
Please note that the last day for submitting bids is (Wednesday), corresponding to (2025/4/30), at (one o'clock in the afternoon). Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
Announcement 2025/41

The holder of the following license has submitted a request to the Municipality:
<table_caption>Commercial License Holder Information for Kuwait Municipality</table_caption>
<table>
| Commercial Name | Laurent International General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة لوران العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> |
|:---|:---|
| Category | Municipality Contractor, Category B |
| Registration No. | 6400127 |

requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality for its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation shall issue its decision after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen (15) days have passed from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration entails the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding uncompleted building contracts concluded between them, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Department at the Engineering Systems Directorate within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

First: Tender documents can be obtained from the Documents and Contracts Department – Third Floor – at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> in South Surra, according to the following terms and requirements when purchasing tender documents:
1. Submission of the company's registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>. (A recent certificate for the year the tender is issued), and a certificate of accreditation for authorized signatories with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
2. Submission of the registration certificate proving the bidder's license with the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>, a commercial registration certificate, a registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>, and the company's articles of association with all attached amendments, attested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> (for local companies).
3. Submission of a registration certificate issued by the competent authorities in the country to which the foreign bidder belongs, provided that it is attested by the official authorities in the country of establishment, and certified by a Kuwaiti consulate or any other entity authorized to certify the company, along with a copy of its articles of association, including all attached amendments, all of which must be in either Arabic or English, legally notarized, and attested by official authorities.
4. Submission of a valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> (for local companies).
5. Tender documents shall be handed over against a non-refundable fee as specified in the table above, by certified check issued in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> or K-Net card.
6. Submission of a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the authorized person to purchase tender documents, along with a copy of the civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature accreditation certificate.
7. Companies that have received a valid penalty in state tenders and projects will not be allowed to participate.
8. Companies with ongoing contracts (under execution) with the Authority that are delayed in delivering any part of the project beyond the contractual completion date by a delay percentage exceeding (50%) of the total contract duration will not be allowed to apply for a new tender until the contract under execution is settled.
9. The deadline for submitting inquiries about the above-mentioned tender is 01/05/2025, provided they are submitted in Arabic (inquiries should be submitted to the Documents and Contracts Department, Third Floor, at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> in South Surra), and no questions or inquiries received by the Authority after this date will be considered.

Second: The following conditions must be adhered to when submitting the bid:
1. The deadline for submitting bids (closing) is 1:00 PM at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> – South Surra – Documents and Contracts Department – Third Floor.
2. Submission of proof that the company has executed and completed works similar to the tender works (required and whose controls are specified in item 'Third: Foundations and Standards') as a main contractor during the last fifteen years (from the date of preliminary handover of the project), along with a copy of the contract and a certificate of work completion issued by the contracting entity.
3. The bidder must attach a clearance certificate stating that there are no impediments related to the labor registered with them at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, in accordance with Circular No. (2) of 2021 issued by the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> on 26/1/2021 (for local companies).
4. Submission of a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the authorized person to submit the bid, along with a copy of the civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature accreditation certificate.
5. The bidder must attach with their bid the preliminary security deposit in their name in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>, or a copy of a guarantee letter issued in Arabic, unconditional, free of any reservations, payable on demand, issued by a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and valid throughout the bid validity period, for the value specified in the announcement or not less than for the tender, or subject to seizure by its creditors or claims for any interest thereon. Cash securities are not accepted, and any bid not accompanied by the preliminary security deposit shall be excluded.
6. The authorized representative of the company shall place all tender documents and all required documents completely, as well as qualification documents, in their designated envelopes according to the instructions in the documents and the tender announcement, and seal them with red wax. Then, they must personally, and under their own responsibility, place the first envelope [bid submission envelope] in the designated box, which contains:
- The bid form and the total bid value (original copies), with complete data, stamped and signed.
- The preliminary security deposit (preliminary guarantee)
- A valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded (for local companies).
- The company's articles of association and a registration certificate issued by the competent authorities in the country to which it belongs, which must be stamped and signed by the official authorities in the country of establishment and certified by a Kuwaiti consulate or any other entity authorized to certify (valid).
- Qualification data (Foundations and Standards)
Third: The bidder is obligated to submit all required documents proving their fulfillment of all conditions and requirements under the Foundations and Standards, along with the bid documents, and place them inside the envelope designated for the Foundations and Standards requirements, as follows:
Required Technical Documents:
(1) The bidder must meet any of the following conditions:
- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, during the last (15) years, contract(s) for (supply and installation) of no less than (3) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (under the supervision of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>), provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and no less than (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.
OR
- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, during the last (15) years, contract(s) for (supply and installation) of no less than (5) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher in the GCC countries (under the supervision of relevant governmental energy authorities), provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and no less than (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.
OR
- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, during the last (15) years, contract(s) for (supply and installation) of no less than (10) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher (under the supervision of relevant governmental energy authorities or the end-user).

and (3) copies of a compact disc (CD) containing all required documents.
2. ## Third: Qualification Documents (Principles and Criteria):
The bidder is obligated to submit all required documents proving compliance with all conditions and requirements of the principles and criteria along with the bid documents, placing them inside the envelope designated for the principles and criteria requirements as follows:

### Required Technical Documents:
(1) The bidder must meet any of the following conditions:
- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) for the supply and installation of at least (3) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (under the supervision of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>), provided that the substations are (**Indoor Substation**) and include (**SF6**) gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.

OR

- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) for the supply and installation of at least (5) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher in the GCC <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries (under the supervision of the governmental bodies concerned with energy), provided that the substations are (**Indoor Substation**) and include (**SF6**) gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.

OR

- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) for the supply and installation of at least (10) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher (under the supervision of governmental bodies concerned with energy or the end-user if the projects/substations are outside the GCC <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries), and at least half of the number (5 substations) must have been executed outside the bidder's country, provided that the projects are (**Indoor Substation**) and include (**SF6**) gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.

OR

- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) for the supply and installation of at least (1) main substation with a voltage of (275 kV) or higher in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (under the supervision of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>), provided that the substations are (**Indoor Substation**) and include (**SF6**) gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (300 MVA) or higher each.

OR

- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) for the supply and installation of at least (2) main substations with a voltage of (275 kV) or higher in the GCC <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries (under the supervision of the governmental bodies concerned with energy), provided that the substations are (**Indoor Substation**) and include (**SF6**) gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (300 MVA) or higher each.
- The main contractor shall submit the contract document signed with the entity, and the acceptance certificate or completion certificate for the substation(s) issued by the governmental bodies concerned with energy or by the end-user if the substation(s) are outside the GCC <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries, provided that no more than (15 years) have passed since the issuance of the certificate.
(3) The main contractor shall submit a client certificate issued by the governmental bodies concerned with energy or by the end-user if the projects/substations are outside the GCC <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries, proving that the projects/substations have been in service for at least one year from the date of operation.

### Financial Documents:
- The company's capital must not be less than one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or its equivalent in other currencies, supported by documentary evidence.
- The company must submit complete financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement) for the last (3) years, certified by an audit firm and attested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- The company must submit certificates from the banks with which the bidder deals, indicating its financial standing and the banks' willingness to provide facilities to it, provided that the certificates are valid and issued within the year of the tender announcement. These will be subject to financial study and analysis to assess financial capability.

### ISO Certificates:
- Valid (**ISO9001**) certificate confirming the bidder's compliance with the standard quality management system.
- Valid (**ISO14001**) certificate confirming the bidder's compliance with the environmental management system.

## Fourth: Rules and Conditions:
1. The bidder must submit (2) original hard copies of the bills of quantities and (3) CD copies of all required documents.
2. In case any of the required documents are issued by an entity outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, they must be attested by all official authorities and by the Embassy of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the country of establishment of the company. The company's articles of association, with all attached amendments, must be attested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> (for local companies).

### Announcement
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. (1-2025/2026) for the purchase of SMS service. Interested parties wishing to submit their bids should visit the bank to purchase the terms and conditions booklet and the technical specifications for the aforementioned practice, according to the details specified below:
